metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26962 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Cross-origin iframes that contained a login form could have been recognized by the login autofill service, and populated. This could have been used in clickjacking attacks, as well as be read across partitions in dynamic first party isolation. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
